Title:
A new species Nigrofomes (Hymenochaetales, Basidiomycota)
from China
Abstract:
A new poroid fungus, Nigrofomes yunnanensis, from tropical
China, is described and illustrated based on morphological
characteristics and phylogenetic analysis. The new species is
characterized perennial, resupinate to effused-reflexed, woody hard and
dark gray to almost black basidiocarps, the lacerate dissepiments, a
monomitic hyphal system, the presence of cystidioles and hyphal pegs,
and broadly ellipsoid basidiospores measuring 45.1 × 3.14.3 µm.
Molecular analysis demonstrates the phylogenetic position of the new
species in Nigrofomes. The discriminating characteristics of the new
species and closely related species are discussed.
